title: Day 3 ‚Äì Unit Converter Dashboard
shortDescription: A dynamic conversion dashboard for Temperature, Length & Weight using JS. Practiced DOM manipulation & logic building.
fullContent:
1. Introduction to Unit Converter Dashboard

üöÄ Day 3 of my #100DaysOfProject Challenge! Today I built a Unit Converter Dashboard using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It allows users to convert between Temperature, Length, and Weight units easily ‚Äî and even view saved results and conversion tips! Excited to keep improving my frontend skills every day. ‚ú®

1.1 Project Overview

A comprehensive conversion tool for multiple unit types.

1.2 Key Features

Supports temperature, length, and weight conversions with saved results.

2. Supported Conversion Types

The dashboard handles various unit conversions seamlessly.

2.1 Temperature Conversion

Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin conversions.

2.2 Length Conversion

Meters, feet, inches, and other length units.

2.3 Weight Conversion

Kilograms, pounds, ounces, and more.

3. Technical Features

Advanced functionality for better user experience.

3.1 Saved Results

Users can save and view previous conversions.

3.2 Conversion Tips

Helpful tips and conversion formulas displayed.

3.3 User Interface

Clean, intuitive dashboard design.

4. Learning Outcomes

Mentored by Dhruv Chaturvedi sir who guides constantly and motivates me through this challenge

4.1 Skills Developed

Improved JavaScript programming and DOM manipulation.

4.2 Challenges Overcome

Learned complex conversion algorithms and data persistence.

4.3 Future Plans

Planning to add more unit types and offline functionality.

title: Day 4 ‚Äì Weather Based Quote App
shortDescription: Created an interactive mood-based quote app. Learned to dynamically change UI using JS arrays, objects, and DOM updates.
fullContent:
1. Introduction to Weather-Based Quote App

üöÄ Day 4 of my #100DaysOfProject Challenge! Hello everyone, I'm Shakshi, and I'm excited to share my project; the Weather-Based Quote webpage This is a simple yet creative webpage built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The concept is that users can select a weather type such as sunny, rainy, or cloudy, and the app instantly displays a motivational quote that matches the selected mood. The background color of the page also changes dynamically based on the chosen weather, making it visually interactive and user-friendly.

1.1 Project Concept

A mood-based quote generator that responds to weather selection.

1.2 User Experience

Dynamic background changes and instant quote updates.

2. Weather Options and Quotes

The app supports multiple weather conditions with corresponding quotes.

2.1 Sunny Weather

Uplifting quotes for bright, positive days.

2.2 Rainy Weather

Reflective and calming quotes for rainy moods.

2.3 Cloudy Weather

Thoughtful quotes for overcast days.

3. Technical Implementation

Through this project, I learned how to handle user input, use arrays and objects in JavaScript, and update the webpage dynamically while maintaining a clean and minimal design.

3.1 JavaScript Arrays and Objects

Organized weather data and quotes in structured data formats.

3.2 Dynamic DOM Updates

Real-time changes to content and styling based on user selection.

3.3 Event Handling

User interaction management and responsive updates.

4. Design and User Interface

It was a great learning experience that helped me strengthen my understanding of front-end development.

4.1 Visual Design

Clean, minimal design with weather-appropriate color schemes.

4.2 Responsive Layout

Works seamlessly across different screen sizes.

4.3 Accessibility

Ensured readable text and intuitive navigation.

5. Learning Outcomes

Mentored by Dhruv Chaturvedi sir

5.1 Skills Acquired

Mastered JavaScript fundamentals and DOM manipulation.

5.2 Challenges Faced

Learned to synchronize visual changes with content updates.

5.3 Future Improvements

Planning to add more weather types and animated transitions.
